# [\#1734 Issue](https://github.com/ethereum/solidity/issues/1734) `closed`: Unable to verify contracts deployed by other contract
**Labels**: `waiting for more input`


#### <img src="https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/224810?u=9d4bdd31329b33f97dbee8e1e3e6f01fa1369d09&v=4" width="50">[3esmit](https://github.com/3esmit) opened issue at [2017-03-03 13:56](https://github.com/ethereum/solidity/issues/1734):

https://etherscan.io/address/0x80822493FC792641C9F6b4F14a71b0cd486B4a7d#code This is a BasicCoin deployed by https://etherscan.io/address/0x9b8eb09a59a180e7798fbe7e099c8c351ac56af0#code

I grabbed the constructor arguments from the transaction, they are
``

I use the same code, specify all the same compiler settings in the BasicCoin than the used in BasicCoinManager verification and there is a different compiled bytecode. 
The contract deployed by BasicCoinManager misses a whole chunk of bytes:
``


Bytecode compiled by solc v0.4.2+commit.af6afb04 (optimization enabled):
``


Bytecode of the deployed contract:
``

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/224810/23553483/b0a8dd18-ffff-11e6-931e-777dd2092539.png)


I talked with @mtbitcoin and he said is unable to verify as bytecodes are different, so I'm opening an issue here to see how we can verify this contracts. 

I know I can trust in the contract creator source, but without this verification I cannot read contract from etherscan.io, unless I contact Matt and ask him for adding the ABI to that contract.

@3esmit is this still an issue?

Have you tried recreating the same with a newer compiler? 0.4.2 had a couple of compiler bugs.
